page.title: 04NEWCOMERS 1
page.content: During the last fifteen years or so, this area seems to have become attractive to city dwellers. Most people who have moved from the city to the "country" seem to have done so for the peaceful life. They are people who have become worried by the ever increasing muggings, violence and robberies now found in the large towns and cities. Small villages are an attractive alternative, particularly if, like those in this area, they are largely undeveloped and sited in areas of natural beauty. To newcomers, villages like Efail Isaf and Gwaelod-y-Garth offer a quiet, secure and peaceful life with the advantage of the ammenities of the towns and city being within easy reach.
